intro: Selinum austriacum var. montanum, commonly known as the Alpine cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, parsley-like scent when crushed. It is often found in mountainous areas of Austria, Switzerland, and southern Germany.
